df-cht
blocks.content: Define the first Chebyshev function, which adds up the logarithms of all primes less than ` x ` , see definition in [ApostolNT] p. 75. The symbol used to represent this function is sometimes the variant greek letter theta shown here and sometimes the greek letter psi, ψ; however, this notation can also refer to the second Chebyshev function, which adds up the logarithms of prime powers instead, see ~ df-chp . See ~ https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chebyshev_function for a discussion of the two functions. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 15-Sep-2014.)

blocks.name: df-vma
blocks.content: Define the von Mangoldt function, which gives the logarithm of the prime at a prime power, and is zero elsewhere, see definition in [ApostolNT] p. 32. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 7-Apr-2016.)

blocks.name: df-chp
blocks.content: Define the second Chebyshev function, which adds up the logarithms of the primes corresponding to the prime powers less than ` x ` , see definition in [ApostolNT] p. 75. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 7-Apr-2016.)

blocks.name: df-ppi
blocks.content: Define the prime π function, which counts the number of primes less than or equal to ` x ` , see definition in [ApostolNT] p. 8. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 15-Sep-2014.)

blocks.name: df-mu
blocks.content: Define the Möbius function, which is zero for non-squarefree numbers and is ` -u 1 ` or ` 1 ` for squarefree numbers according as to the number of prime divisors of the number is even or odd, see definition in [ApostolNT] p. 24. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 22-Sep-2014.)

blocks.name: df-sgm
blocks.content: Define the sum of positive divisors function ` ( x sigma n ) ` , which is the sum of the xth powers of the positive integer divisors of n, see definition in [ApostolNT] p. 38. For ` x = 0 ` , ` ( x sigma n ) ` counts the number of divisors of ` n ` , i.e. ` ( 0 sigma n ) ` is _the_ divisor function, see remark in [ApostolNT] p. 38. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 22-Sep-2014.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-sgm(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3) {
  |- wceq(csgm, cmpo(s0, s1, cc, cn, csu(s2, crab(s3, cn, wbr(cv(s3), cdvds, cv(s1))), co(cv(s2), ccxp, cv(s0)))))
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
}
blocks.pretty:
axiom df-sgm(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3) {
  ⊢ σ =(s0 ∈ ℂ, s1 ∈ ℕ ↦ sum(s2 ∈ { s3 ∈ ℕ | s3[||]s1 },(s2[^c]s0)))
  ⊣ d(s1, s2)
  ⊣ d(s2, s3)
  ⊣ d(s0, s2)
  ⊣ d(s1, s3)
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, s3)
}

blocks.name: efnnfsumcl
blocks.content: Finite sum closure in the log-integers. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 7-Apr-2016.)

thm efnnfsumcl(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wcel(cfv(ce, csu(s0, c0, c1)), cn))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, cfn))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wcel(c1, cr))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wcel(cfv(ce, c1), cn))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
} = {
  syl(w0, wcel(cfv(ce, csu(s0, c0, c1)), cn), wcel(csu(s0, c0, c1), crab(hs0, cr, wcel(cfv(ce, cv(hs0)), cn))))
  fsumcllem(s0, hs1, hs2, c0, c1, crab(hs0, cr, wcel(cfv(ce, cv(hs0)), cn)), w0)
  a1i(w0, wss(crab(hs0, cr, wcel(cfv(ce, cv(hs0)), cn)), cc))
  sstri(crab(hs0, cr, wcel(cfv(ce, cv(hs0)), cn)), cc, cr)
  ssrab2(hs0, cr, wcel(cfv(ce, cv(hs0)), cn))
  ax-resscn()
  adantl(w0, wa(wcel(cv(hs1), crab(hs0, cr, wcel(cfv(ce, cv(hs0)), cn))), wcel(cv(hs2), crab(hs0, cr, wcel(cfv(ce, cv(hs0)), cn)))), wcel(co(cv(hs1), caddc, cv(hs2)), crab(hs0, cr, wcel(cfv(ce, cv(hs0)), cn))))
  syl2anb(wcel(cv(hs1), crab(hs0, cr, wcel(cfv(ce, cv(hs0)), cn))), wcel(cv(hs2), crab(hs0, cr, wcel(cfv(ce, cv(hs0)), cn))), wcel(co(cv(hs1), caddc, cv(hs2)), crab(hs0, cr, wcel(cfv(ce, cv(hs0)), cn))), wa(wcel(cv(hs1), cr), wcel(cfv(ce, cv(hs1)), cn)), wa(wcel(cv(hs2), cr), wcel(cfv(ce, cv(hs2)), cn)))
  elrab(hs0, cv(hs1), cr, wcel(cfv(ce, cv(hs0)), cn), wcel(cfv(ce, cv(hs1)), cn))
  eleq1d(cfv(ce, cv(hs0)), cn, cfv(ce, cv(hs1)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)))
  fveq2(cv(hs0), cv(hs1), ce)
  elrab(hs0, cv(hs2), cr, wcel(cfv(ce, cv(hs0)), cn), wcel(cfv(ce, cv(hs2)), cn))
  eleq1d(cfv(ce, cv(hs0)), cn, cfv(ce, cv(hs2)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs2)))
  fveq2(cv(hs0), cv(hs2), ce)
  elrabd(hs0, co(cv(hs1), caddc, cv(hs2)), cr, wa(wa(wcel(cv(hs1), cr), wcel(cfv(ce, cv(hs1)), cn)), wa(wcel(cv(hs2), cr), wcel(cfv(ce, cv(hs2)), cn))), wcel(cfv(ce, cv(hs0)), cn), wcel(cfv(ce, co(cv(hs1), caddc, cv(hs2))), cn))
  eleq1d(cfv(ce, cv(hs0)), cn, cfv(ce, co(cv(hs1), caddc, cv(hs2))), wceq(cv(hs0), co(cv(hs1), caddc, cv(hs2))))
  fveq2(cv(hs0), co(cv(hs1), caddc, cv(hs2)), ce)
  readdcld(cv(hs1), cv(hs2), wa(wa(wcel(cv(hs1), cr), wcel(cfv(ce, cv(hs1)), cn)), wa(wcel(cv(hs2), cr), wcel(cfv(ce, cv(hs2)), cn))))
  eqeltrd(cfv(ce, co(cv(hs1), caddc, cv(hs2))), cn, co(cfv(ce, cv(hs1)), cmul, cfv(ce, cv(hs2))), wa(wa(wcel(cv(hs1), cr), wcel(cfv(ce, cv(hs1)), cn)), wa(wcel(cv(hs2), cr), wcel(cfv(ce, cv(hs2)), cn))))
  syl2anc(wa(wa(wcel(cv(hs1), cr), wcel(cfv(ce, cv(hs1)), cn)), wa(wcel(cv(hs2), cr), wcel(cfv(ce, cv(hs2)), cn))), wceq(cfv(ce, co(cv(hs1), caddc, cv(hs2))), co(cfv(ce, cv(hs1)), cmul, cfv(ce, cv(hs2)))), wcel(cv(hs1), cc), wcel(cv(hs2), cc))
  recnd(cv(hs1), wa(wa(wcel(cv(hs1), cr), wcel(cfv(ce, cv(hs1)), cn)), wa(wcel(cv(hs2), cr), wcel(cfv(ce, cv(hs2)), cn))))
  simpll(wcel(cv(hs1), cr), wcel(cfv(ce, cv(hs1)), cn), wa(wcel(cv(hs2), cr), wcel(cfv(ce, cv(hs2)), cn)))
  recnd(cv(hs2), wa(wa(wcel(cv(hs1), cr), wcel(cfv(ce, cv(hs1)), cn)), wa(wcel(cv(hs2), cr), wcel(cfv(ce, cv(hs2)), cn))))
  simprl(wa(wcel(cv(hs1), cr), wcel(cfv(ce, cv(hs1)), cn)), wcel(cv(hs2), cr), wcel(cfv(ce, cv(hs2)), cn))

  eleq1d(cfv(ce, cv(hs0)), cn, cfv(ce, c1), wceq(cv(hs0), c1))

  mpbir2an(wcel(nat0, crab(hs0, cr, wcel(cfv(ce, cv(hs0)), cn))), wcel(nat0, cr), wcel(nat1, cn))
  0re()
  1nn()
  elrab(hs0, nat0, cr, wcel(cfv(ce, cv(hs0)), cn), wcel(nat1, cn))
  eleq1d(cfv(ce, cv(hs0)), cn, nat1, wceq(cv(hs0), nat0))
  syl6eq(cfv(ce, cv(hs0)), nat1, cfv(ce, nat0), wceq(cv(hs0), nat0))
  fveq2(cv(hs0), nat0, ce)
  ef0()
  simprbi(wcel(csu(s0, c0, c1), crab(hs0, cr, wcel(cfv(ce, cv(hs0)), cn))), wcel(cfv(ce, csu(s0, c0, c1)), cn), wcel(csu(s0, c0, c1), cr))
  elrab(hs0, csu(s0, c0, c1), cr, wcel(cfv(ce, cv(hs0)), cn), wcel(cfv(ce, csu(s0, c0, c1)), cn))
  eleq1d(cfv(ce, cv(hs0)), cn, cfv(ce, csu(s0, c0, c1)), wceq(cv(hs0), csu(s0, c0, c1)))
  fveq2(cv(hs0), csu(s0, c0, c1), ce)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs1)
  diff.hs1.s(s0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs2)
  diff.hs2.s(s0)
  diff.hs1.s(hs2)
  diff.crab.s(s0, hs0, cr, wcel(cfv(ce, cv(hs0)), cn))
  diff.cr.s(s0)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, cfv(ce, cv(hs0)), cn)
  diff.cfv.s(s0, ce, cv(hs0))
  diff.ce.s(s0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.cn.s(s0)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c1)
  diff.hs1.c(crab(hs0, cr, wcel(cfv(ce, cv(hs0)), cn)))
  diff.hs2.c(c0)
  diff.hs2.c(c1)
  diff.hs2.c(crab(hs0, cr, wcel(cfv(ce, cv(hs0)), cn)))
  diff.hs1.w(w0)
  diff.hs2.w(w0)
  diff.hs0.c(cr)
  diff.hs0.c(cv(hs1))
  diff.hs0.w(wcel(cfv(ce, cv(hs1)), cn))
  diff.hs0.c(cv(hs2))
  diff.hs0.w(wcel(cfv(ce, cv(hs2)), cn))
  diff.hs0.c(co(cv(hs1), caddc, cv(hs2)))
  diff.hs0.w(wcel(cfv(ce, co(cv(hs1), caddc, cv(hs2))), cn))
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.w(wcel(cfv(ce, c1), cn))
  diff.hs0.c(nat0)
  diff.hs0.w(wcel(nat1, cn))
  diff.hs0.c(csu(s0, c0, c1))
  diff.hs0.w(wcel(cfv(ce, csu(s0, c0, c1)), cn))
}

thm efnnfsumcl(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, wff w0) {
  ⊢ (w0 →(exp ` sum(s0 ∈ c0, c1))∈ ℕ)
  ⊣ (w0 → c0 ∈ Fin)
  ⊣ ((w0 ∧ s0 ∈ c0)→ c1 ∈ ℝ)
  ⊣ ((w0 ∧ s0 ∈ c0)→(exp ` c1)∈ ℕ)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, w0)
} = {
  syl(w0, (exp ` sum(s0 ∈ c0, c1))∈ ℕ, sum(s0 ∈ c0, c1)∈ { hs0 ∈ ℝ |(exp ` hs0)∈ ℕ })
  fsumcllem(s0, hs1, hs2, c0, c1, { hs0 ∈ ℝ |(exp ` hs0)∈ ℕ }, w0)
  a1i(w0, { hs0 ∈ ℝ |(exp ` hs0)∈ ℕ } ⊆ ℂ)
  sstri({ hs0 ∈ ℝ |(exp ` hs0)∈ ℕ }, cc, cr)
  ssrab2(hs0, cr, (exp ` hs0)∈ ℕ)
  ax-resscn()
  adantl(w0, (hs1 ∈ { hs0 ∈ ℝ |(exp ` hs0)∈ ℕ } ∧ hs2 ∈ { hs0 ∈ ℝ |(exp ` hs0)∈ ℕ }), (hs1[+]hs2)∈ { hs0 ∈ ℝ |(exp ` hs0)∈ ℕ })
  syl2anb(hs1 ∈ { hs0 ∈ ℝ |(exp ` hs0)∈ ℕ }, hs2 ∈ { hs0 ∈ ℝ |(exp ` hs0)∈ ℕ }, (hs1[+]hs2)∈ { hs0 ∈ ℝ |(exp ` hs0)∈ ℕ }, (hs1 ∈ ℝ ∧(exp ` hs1)∈ ℕ), (hs2 ∈ ℝ ∧(exp ` hs2)∈ ℕ))
  elrab(hs0, hs1, cr, (exp ` hs0)∈ ℕ, (exp ` hs1)∈ ℕ)
  eleq1d((exp ` hs0), cn, (exp ` hs1), hs0 = hs1)
  fveq2(hs0, hs1, ce)
  elrab(hs0, hs2, cr, (exp ` hs0)∈ ℕ, (exp ` hs2)∈ ℕ)
  eleq1d((exp ` hs0), cn, (exp ` hs2), hs0 = hs2)
  fveq2(hs0, hs2, ce)
  elrabd(hs0, (hs1[+]hs2), cr, ((hs1 ∈ ℝ ∧(exp ` hs1)∈ ℕ)∧(hs2 ∈ ℝ ∧(exp ` hs2)∈ ℕ)), (exp ` hs0)∈ ℕ, (exp `(hs1[+]hs2))∈ ℕ)
  eleq1d((exp ` hs0), cn, (exp `(hs1[+]hs2)), hs0 =(hs1[+]hs2))
  fveq2(hs0, (hs1[+]hs2), ce)
  readdcld(hs1, hs2, ((hs1 ∈ ℝ ∧(exp ` hs1)∈ ℕ)∧(hs2 ∈ ℝ ∧(exp ` hs2)∈ ℕ)))
  eqeltrd((exp `(hs1[+]hs2)), cn, ((exp ` hs1)[×](exp ` hs2)), ((hs1 ∈ ℝ ∧(exp ` hs1)∈ ℕ)∧(hs2 ∈ ℝ ∧(exp ` hs2)∈ ℕ)))
  syl2anc(((hs1 ∈ ℝ ∧(exp ` hs1)∈ ℕ)∧(hs2 ∈ ℝ ∧(exp ` hs2)∈ ℕ)), (exp `(hs1[+]hs2))=((exp ` hs1)[×](exp ` hs2)), hs1 ∈ ℂ, hs2 ∈ ℂ)
  recnd(hs1, ((hs1 ∈ ℝ ∧(exp ` hs1)∈ ℕ)∧(hs2 ∈ ℝ ∧(exp ` hs2)∈ ℕ)))
  simpll(hs1 ∈ ℝ, (exp ` hs1)∈ ℕ, (hs2 ∈ ℝ ∧(exp ` hs2)∈ ℕ))
  recnd(hs2, ((hs1 ∈ ℝ ∧(exp ` hs1)∈ ℕ)∧(hs2 ∈ ℝ ∧(exp ` hs2)∈ ℕ)))
  simprl((hs1 ∈ ℝ ∧(exp ` hs1)∈ ℕ), hs2 ∈ ℝ, (exp ` hs2)∈ ℕ)
  efadd(hs1, hs2)
  ad2ant2l(hs1 ∈ ℝ, (exp ` hs1)∈ ℕ, hs2 ∈ ℝ, (exp ` hs2)∈ ℕ, ((exp ` hs1)[×](exp ` hs2))∈ ℕ)
  nnmulcl((exp ` hs1), (exp ` hs2))
  elrabd(hs0, c1, cr, (w0 ∧ s0 ∈ c0), (exp ` hs0)∈ ℕ, (exp ` c1)∈ ℕ)
  eleq1d((exp ` hs0), cn, (exp ` c1), hs0 = c1)
  fveq2(hs0, c1, ce)
  a1i(w0, 0 ∈ { hs0 ∈ ℝ |(exp ` hs0)∈ ℕ })
  mpbir2an(0 ∈ { hs0 ∈ ℝ |(exp ` hs0)∈ ℕ }, 0 ∈ ℝ, 1 ∈ ℕ)
  0re()
  1nn()
  elrab(hs0, nat0, cr, (exp ` hs0)∈ ℕ, 1 ∈ ℕ)
  eleq1d((exp ` hs0), cn, nat1, hs0 = 0)
  syl6eq((exp ` hs0), nat1, (exp ` 0), hs0 = 0)
  fveq2(hs0, nat0, ce)
  ef0()
  simprbi(sum(s0 ∈ c0, c1)∈ { hs0 ∈ ℝ |(exp ` hs0)∈ ℕ }, (exp ` sum(s0 ∈ c0, c1))∈ ℕ, sum(s0 ∈ c0, c1)∈ ℝ)
  elrab(hs0, sum(s0 ∈ c0, c1), cr, (exp ` hs0)∈ ℕ, (exp ` sum(s0 ∈ c0, c1))∈ ℕ)
  eleq1d((exp ` hs0), cn, (exp ` sum(s0 ∈ c0, c1)), hs0 = sum(s0 ∈ c0, c1))
  fveq2(hs0, sum(s0 ∈ c0, c1), ce)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs1)
  diff.hs1.s(s0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs2)
  diff.hs2.s(s0)
  diff.hs1.s(hs2)
  diff.crab.s(s0, hs0, cr, (exp ` hs0)∈ ℕ)
  diff.cr.s(s0)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, (exp ` hs0), cn)
  diff.cfv.s(s0, ce, hs0)
  diff.ce.s(s0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.cn.s(s0)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c1)
  diff.hs1.c({ hs0 ∈ ℝ |(exp ` hs0)∈ ℕ })
  diff.hs2.c(c0)
  diff.hs2.c(c1)
  diff.hs2.c({ hs0 ∈ ℝ |(exp ` hs0)∈ ℕ })
  diff.hs1.w(w0)
  diff.hs2.w(w0)
  diff.hs0.c(cr)
  diff.hs0.c(hs1)
  diff.hs0.w((exp ` hs1)∈ ℕ)
  diff.hs0.c(hs2)
  diff.hs0.w((exp ` hs2)∈ ℕ)
  diff.hs0.c((hs1[+]hs2))
  diff.hs0.w((exp `(hs1[+]hs2))∈ ℕ)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.w((exp ` c1)∈ ℕ)
  diff.hs0.c(nat0)
  diff.hs0.w(1 ∈ ℕ)
  diff.hs0.c(sum(s0 ∈ c0, c1))
  diff.hs0.w((exp ` sum(s0 ∈ c0, c1))∈ ℕ)
}

blocks.name: ppisval
blocks.content: The set of primes less than ` A ` expressed using a finite set of integers. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 22-Sep-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm ppisval(class c0) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cr), wceq(cin(co(nat0, cicc, c0), cprime), cin(co(nat2, cfz, cfv(cfl, c0)), cprime)))
} = {
  eqssd(cin(co(nat0, cicc, c0), cprime), cin(co(nat2, cfz, cfv(cfl, c0)), cprime), wcel(c0, cr))
  ssrdv(hs0, cin(co(nat0, cicc, c0), cprime), cin(co(nat2, cfz, cfv(cfl, c0)), cprime), wcel(c0, cr))
  ex(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(cv(hs0), cin(co(nat0, cicc, c0), cprime)), wcel(cv(hs0), cin(co(nat2, cfz, cfv(cfl, c0)), cprime)))
  elind(cv(hs0), co(nat2, cfz, cfv(cfl, c0)), cprime, wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(cv(hs0), cin(co(nat0, cicc, c0), cprime))))
  sylanbrc(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(cv(hs0), cin(co(nat0, cicc, c0), cprime))), wcel(cv(hs0), co(nat2, cfz, cfv(cfl, c0))), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cuz, nat2)), wcel(cfv(cfl, c0), cfv(cuz, cv(hs0))))
  syl(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(cv(hs0), cin(co(nat0, cicc, c0), cprime))), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cuz, nat2)), wcel(cv(hs0), cprime))
  prmuz2(cv(hs0))
  syl3anbrc(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(cv(hs0), cin(co(nat0, cicc, c0), cprime))), wcel(cfv(cfl, c0), cfv(cuz, cv(hs0))), wcel(cv(hs0), cz), wcel(cfv(cfl, c0), cz), wbr(cv(hs0), cle, cfv(cfl, c0)))
  adantr(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(cv(hs0), cin(co(nat0, cicc, c0), cprime)), wcel(cfv(cfl, c0), cz))
  mpbid(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(cv(hs0), cin(co(nat0, cicc, c0), cprime))), wbr(cv(hs0), cle, cfv(cfl, c0)), wbr(cv(hs0), cle, c0))
  simp3d(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(cv(hs0), cin(co(nat0, cicc, c0), cprime))), wbr(cv(hs0), cle, c0), wcel(cv(hs0), cr), wbr(nat0, cle, cv(hs0)))
  mpbid(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(cv(hs0), cin(co(nat0, cicc, c0), cprime))), w3a(wcel(cv(hs0), cr), wbr(nat0, cle, cv(hs0)), wbr(cv(hs0), cle, c0)), wcel(cv(hs0), co(nat0, cicc, c0)))
  elin1d(cv(hs0), co(nat0, cicc, c0), cprime, wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(cv(hs0), cin(co(nat0, cicc, c0), cprime))))

thm ppisval2(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(nat2, cfv(cuz, c1))), wceq(cin(co(nat0, cicc, c0), cprime), cin(co(c1, cfz, cfv(cfl, c0)), cprime)))
} = {

  ssrind(co(nat2, cfz, cfv(cfl, c0)), cprime, co(c1, cfz, cfv(cfl, c0)), wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(nat2, cfv(cuz, c1))))
  adantl(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(nat2, cfv(cuz, c1)), wss(co(nat2, cfz, cfv(cfl, c0)), co(c1, cfz, cfv(cfl, c0))))
  fzss1(nat2, c1, cfv(cfl, c0))
  elind(cv(hs0), co(nat2, cfz, cfv(cfl, c0)), cprime, wa(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(nat2, cfv(cuz, c1))), wcel(cv(hs0), cin(co(c1, cfz, cfv(cfl, c0)), cprime))))
  sylanbrc(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(nat2, cfv(cuz, c1))), wcel(cv(hs0), cin(co(c1, cfz, cfv(cfl, c0)), cprime))), wcel(cv(hs0), co(nat2, cfz, cfv(cfl, c0))), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cuz, nat2)), wcel(cfv(cfl, c0), cfv(cuz, cv(hs0))))
  syl(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(nat2, cfv(cuz, c1))), wcel(cv(hs0), cin(co(c1, cfz, cfv(cfl, c0)), cprime))), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cuz, nat2)), wcel(cv(hs0), cprime))

  simpld(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(nat2, cfv(cuz, c1))), wcel(cv(hs0), cin(co(c1, cfz, cfv(cfl, c0)), cprime))), wcel(cv(hs0), co(c1, cfz, cfv(cfl, c0))), wcel(cv(hs0), cprime))
  elfzuz3(cv(hs0), c1, cfv(cfl, c0))
  elfzuzb(cv(hs0), nat2, cfv(cfl, c0))
  simprd(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(nat2, cfv(cuz, c1))), wcel(cv(hs0), cin(co(c1, cfz, cfv(cfl, c0)), cprime))), wcel(cv(hs0), cprime), wcel(cv(hs0), co(c1, cfz, cfv(cfl, c0))))
  sylib(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(nat2, cfv(cuz, c1))), wcel(cv(hs0), cin(co(c1, cfz, cfv(cfl, c0)), cprime))), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), co(c1, cfz, cfv(cfl, c0))), wcel(cv(hs0), cprime)), wcel(cv(hs0), cin(co(c1, cfz, cfv(cfl, c0)), cprime)))
  simpr(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(nat2, cfv(cuz, c1))), wcel(cv(hs0), cin(co(c1, cfz, cfv(cfl, c0)), cprime)))

blocks.name: prmdvdsfi

thm prmdvdsfi(setvar s0, class c0) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(crab(s0, cprime, wbr(cv(s0), cdvds, c0)), cfn))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
} = {
  sylancr(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(crab(s0, cprime, wbr(cv(s0), cdvds, c0)), cfn), wcel(co(nat1, cfz, c0), cfn), wss(crab(s0, cprime, wbr(cv(s0), cdvds, c0)), co(nat1, cfz, c0)))
  fzfi(nat1, c0)
  syl5ss(crab(s0, cprime, wbr(cv(s0), cdvds, c0)), co(nat1, cfz, c0), crab(s0, cn, wbr(cv(s0), cdvds, c0)), wcel(c0, cn))
  ax-mp(wss(crab(s0, cprime, wbr(cv(s0), cdvds, c0)), crab(s0, cn, wbr(cv(s0), cdvds, c0))), wss(cprime, cn))
  prmssnn()
  rabss2(s0, cprime, cn, wbr(cv(s0), cdvds, c0))
  dvdsssfz1(s0, c0)
  ssfi(co(nat1, cfz, c0), crab(s0, cprime, wbr(cv(s0), cdvds, c0)))
  diff.cprime.s(s0)
  diff.cn.s(s0)
}

thm prmdvdsfi(setvar s0, class c0) {

} = {
  sylancr(c0 ∈ ℕ, { s0 ∈ Prime | s0[||]c0 } ∈ Fin, (1[...]c0)∈ Fin, { s0 ∈ Prime | s0[||]c0 } ⊆(1[...]c0))
  fzfi(nat1, c0)

  ax-mp({ s0 ∈ Prime | s0[||]c0 } ⊆ { s0 ∈ ℕ | s0[||]c0 }, Prime ⊆ ℕ)
  prmssnn()

  syl(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(cv(hs0), cin(co(nat0, cicc, c0), cprime))), wcel(cv(hs0), cn), wcel(cv(hs0), cprime))
  elin2d(cv(hs0), cprime, co(nat0, cicc, c0), wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(cv(hs0), cin(co(nat0, cicc, c0), cprime))))

thm chtge0(class c0) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cr), wbr(nat0, cle, cfv(ccht, c0)))

  breqtrrd(nat0, cle, cfv(ccht, c0), csu(hs0, cin(co(nat0, cicc, c0), cprime), cfv(clog, cv(hs0))), wcel(c0, cr))

  rpge0d(cfv(clog, cv(hs0)), wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(cv(hs0), cin(co(nat0, cicc, c0), cprime))))
  rplogcld(cv(hs0), wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(cv(hs0), cin(co(nat0, cicc, c0), cprime))))
  nnred(cv(hs0), wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(cv(hs0), cin(co(nat0, cicc, c0), cprime))))
  simpld(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(cv(hs0), cin(co(nat0, cicc, c0), cprime))), wcel(cv(hs0), cn), wbr(nat1, clt, cv(hs0)))
  simprd(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(cv(hs0), cin(co(nat0, cicc, c0), cprime))), wbr(nat1, clt, cv(hs0)), wcel(cv(hs0), cn))
  sylib(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(cv(hs0), cin(co(nat0, cicc, c0), cprime))), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cn), wbr(nat1, clt, cv(hs0))), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cuz, nat2)))
  syl(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(cv(hs0), cin(co(nat0, cicc, c0), cprime))), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cuz, nat2)), wcel(cv(hs0), cprime))

blocks.name: isppw2
blocks.content: Two ways to say that ` A ` is a prime power. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 7-Apr-2016.)

  impbid(wa(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cn)), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cprime), wbr(cv(hs0), cdvds, co(c0, cexp, c1))), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  expimpd(wa(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cn)), wcel(cv(hs0), cprime), wbr(cv(hs0), cdvds, co(c0, cexp, c1)), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  3expa(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cn), wcel(cv(hs0), cprime), wi(wbr(cv(hs0), cdvds, co(c0, cexp, c1)), wceq(cv(hs0), c0)))
  3coml(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cn), wcel(cv(hs0), cprime), wi(wbr(cv(hs0), cdvds, co(c0, cexp, c1)), wceq(cv(hs0), c0)))
  biimpd(w3a(wcel(cv(hs0), cprime), wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cn)), wbr(cv(hs0), cdvds, co(c0, cexp, c1)), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  prmdvdsexpb(cv(hs0), c0, c1)
  syl5ibrcom(wa(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cn)), wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cprime), wbr(cv(hs0), cdvds, co(c0, cexp, c1))), wa(wcel(c0, cprime), wbr(c0, cdvds, co(c0, cexp, c1))))
  jca(wa(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cn)), wcel(c0, cprime), wbr(c0, cdvds, co(c0, cexp, c1)))
  simpl(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cn))
  sylan(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cn), wbr(c0, cdvds, co(c0, cexp, c1)), wcel(c0, cz))
  prmz(c0)
  iddvdsexp(c0, c1)
  anbi12d(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(cv(hs0), cprime), wbr(cv(hs0), cdvds, co(c0, cexp, c1)), wcel(c0, cprime), wbr(c0, cdvds, co(c0, cexp, c1)))
  eleq1(cv(hs0), c0, cprime)
  breq1(cv(hs0), c0, cdvds, co(c0, cexp, c1))

  diff.hs0.c(csn(c0))
  diff.hs0.w(wa(wcel(c0, cprime), wcel(c1, cn)))
}

thm vmappw(class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ Prime ∧ c1 ∈ ℕ)→(Lam `(c0[^]c1))=(log ` c0))
} = {
  3eqtrd((Lam `(c0[^]c1)), (log ` c0), if((# ` { hs0 ∈ Prime | hs0[||](c0[^]c1)})= 1,(log ` ⋃ { hs0 ∈ Prime | hs0[||](c0[^]c1)}), 0), (log ` ⋃ { hs0 ∈ Prime | hs0[||](c0[^]c1)}), (c0 ∈ Prime ∧ c1 ∈ ℕ))
  syl((c0 ∈ Prime ∧ c1 ∈ ℕ), (Lam `(c0[^]c1))= if((# ` { hs0 ∈ Prime | hs0[||](c0[^]c1)})= 1,(log ` ⋃ { hs0 ∈ Prime | hs0[||](c0[^]c1)}), 0), (c0[^]c1)∈ ℕ)
  syl2an(c0 ∈ Prime, c1 ∈ ℕ, (c0[^]c1)∈ ℕ, c0 ∈ ℕ, c1 ∈ ℕ0)
  prmnn(c0)
  nnnn0(c1)
  nnexpcl(c0, c1)
  vmaval(hs0, (c0[^]c1), { hs0 ∈ Prime | hs0[||](c0[^]c1)})
  eqid({ hs0 ∈ Prime | hs0[||](c0[^]c1)})
  iftrued((log ` ⋃ { hs0 ∈ Prime | hs0[||](c0[^]c1)}), nat0, (c0 ∈ Prime ∧ c1 ∈ ℕ), (# ` { hs0 ∈ Prime | hs0[||](c0[^]c1)})= 1)
  eqtrd((# ` { hs0 ∈ Prime | hs0[||](c0[^]c1)}), nat1, (# ` { c0 }), (c0 ∈ Prime ∧ c1 ∈ ℕ))
  fveq2d(chash, { hs0 ∈ Prime | hs0[||](c0[^]c1)}, { c0 }, (c0 ∈ Prime ∧ c1 ∈ ℕ))
  adantr(c0 ∈ Prime, c1 ∈ ℕ, (# ` { c0 })= 1)
  hashsng(c0, cprime)
  fveq2d(clog, ⋃ { hs0 ∈ Prime | hs0[||](c0[^]c1)}, c0, (c0 ∈ Prime ∧ c1 ∈ ℕ))
  eqtrd(⋃ { hs0 ∈ Prime | hs0[||](c0[^]c1)}, c0, ⋃ { c0 }, (c0 ∈ Prime ∧ c1 ∈ ℕ))
  unieqd({ hs0 ∈ Prime | hs0[||](c0[^]c1)}, { c0 }, (c0 ∈ Prime ∧ c1 ∈ ℕ))
  syl5eq({ hs0 ∈ Prime | hs0[||](c0[^]c1)}, { c0 }, { hs0 |(hs0 ∈ Prime ∧ hs0[||](c0[^]c1))}, (c0 ∈ Prime ∧ c1 ∈ ℕ))
  df-rab(hs0, cprime, hs0[||](c0[^]c1))
  abbi1dv(hs0, { c0 }, (c0 ∈ Prime ∧ c1 ∈ ℕ), (hs0 ∈ Prime ∧ hs0[||](c0[^]c1)))
  syl6bbr((c0 ∈ Prime ∧ c1 ∈ ℕ), (hs0 ∈ Prime ∧ hs0[||](c0[^]c1)), hs0 ∈ { c0 }, hs0 = c0)
  impbid((c0 ∈ Prime ∧ c1 ∈ ℕ), (hs0 ∈ Prime ∧ hs0[||](c0[^]c1)), hs0 = c0)
  expimpd((c0 ∈ Prime ∧ c1 ∈ ℕ), hs0 ∈ Prime, hs0[||](c0[^]c1), hs0 = c0)
  3expa(c0 ∈ Prime, c1 ∈ ℕ, hs0 ∈ Prime, (hs0[||](c0[^]c1)→ hs0 = c0))
  3coml(c0 ∈ Prime, c1 ∈ ℕ, hs0 ∈ Prime, (hs0[||](c0[^]c1)→ hs0 = c0))
  biimpd((hs0 ∈ Prime ∧ c0 ∈ Prime ∧ c1 ∈ ℕ), hs0[||](c0[^]c1), hs0 = c0)
  prmdvdsexpb(hs0, c0, c1)
  syl5ibrcom((c0 ∈ Prime ∧ c1 ∈ ℕ), hs0 = c0, (hs0 ∈ Prime ∧ hs0[||](c0[^]c1)), (c0 ∈ Prime ∧ c0[||](c0[^]c1)))
  jca((c0 ∈ Prime ∧ c1 ∈ ℕ), c0 ∈ Prime, c0[||](c0[^]c1))
  simpl(c0 ∈ Prime, c1 ∈ ℕ)
  sylan(c0 ∈ Prime, c1 ∈ ℕ, c0[||](c0[^]c1), c0 ∈ ℤ)
  prmz(c0)
  iddvdsexp(c0, c1)
  anbi12d(hs0 = c0, hs0 ∈ Prime, hs0[||](c0[^]c1), c0 ∈ Prime, c0[||](c0[^]c1))
  eleq1(hs0, c0, cprime)
  breq1(hs0, c0, cdvds, (c0[^]c1))
  velsn(hs0, c0)
  adantr(c0 ∈ Prime, c1 ∈ ℕ, ⋃ { c0 } = c0)
  unisng(c0, cprime)
  diff.hs0.c((c0[^]c1))
  diff.hs0.c({ c0 })
  diff.hs0.w((c0 ∈ Prime ∧ c1 ∈ ℕ))
}

blocks.name: vmacl
blocks.content: Closure for the von Mangoldt function. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 7-Apr-2016.)
blocks.origin:
thm vmacl(class c0) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(cfv(cvma, c0), cr))
} = {
  pm2.61ne(cfv(cvma, c0), nat0, wcel(c0, cn), wcel(cfv(cvma, c0), cr), wcel(nat0, cr))
  eleq1(cfv(cvma, c0), nat0, cr)
  imp(wcel(c0, cn), wne(cfv(cvma, c0), nat0), wcel(cfv(cvma, c0), cr))
  syl6bi(wcel(c0, cn), wne(cfv(cvma, c0), nat0), wcel(cfv(cvma, c0), cr), wrex(hs0, cprime, wrex(hs1, cn, wceq(c0, co(cv(hs0), cexp, cv(hs1))))))
  isppw2(hs0, hs1, c0)
  rexlimivv(hs0, hs1, cprime, cn, wceq(c0, co(cv(hs0), cexp, cv(hs1))), wcel(cfv(cvma, c0), cr))
  syl5ibrcom(wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cprime), wcel(cv(hs1), cn)), wceq(c0, co(cv(hs0), cexp, cv(hs1))), wcel(cfv(cvma, c0), cr), wcel(cfv(cvma, co(cv(hs0), cexp, cv(hs1))), cr))
  eqeltrd(cfv(cvma, co(cv(hs0), cexp, cv(hs1))), cr, cfv(clog, cv(hs0)), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cprime), wcel(cv(hs1), cn)))
  vmappw(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))
  adantr(wcel(cv(hs0), cprime), wcel(cv(hs1), cn), wcel(cfv(clog, cv(hs0)), cr))
  relogcld(cv(hs0), wcel(cv(hs0), cprime))
  nnrpd(cv(hs0), wcel(cv(hs0), cprime))
  prmnn(cv(hs0))
  eleq1d(cfv(cvma, c0), cr, cfv(cvma, co(cv(hs0), cexp, cv(hs1))), wceq(c0, co(cv(hs0), cexp, cv(hs1))))
  fveq2(c0, co(cv(hs0), cexp, cv(hs1)), cvma)
  0red(wcel(c0, cn))
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(cprime)
  diff.hs0.w(wcel(cfv(cvma, c0), cr))
  diff.hs1.w(wcel(cfv(cvma, c0), cr))
}

  ⊢ (c0 ∈ ℕ →(Lam ` c0)∈ ℝ)
} = {
  pm2.61ne((Lam ` c0), nat0, c0 ∈ ℕ, (Lam ` c0)∈ ℝ, 0 ∈ ℝ)
  eleq1((Lam ` c0), nat0, cr)
  imp(c0 ∈ ℕ, (Lam ` c0)≠ 0, (Lam ` c0)∈ ℝ)
  syl6bi(c0 ∈ ℕ, (Lam ` c0)≠ 0, (Lam ` c0)∈ ℝ, ∃(hs0 ∈ Prime, ∃(hs1 ∈ ℕ, c0 =(hs0[^]hs1))))
  isppw2(hs0, hs1, c0)
  rexlimivv(hs0, hs1, cprime, cn, c0 =(hs0[^]hs1), (Lam ` c0)∈ ℝ)
  syl5ibrcom((hs0 ∈ Prime ∧ hs1 ∈ ℕ), c0 =(hs0[^]hs1), (Lam ` c0)∈ ℝ, (Lam `(hs0[^]hs1))∈ ℝ)
  eqeltrd((Lam `(hs0[^]hs1)), cr, (log ` hs0), (hs0 ∈ Prime ∧ hs1 ∈ ℕ))
  vmappw(hs0, hs1)

  relogcld(hs0, hs0 ∈ Prime)
  nnrpd(hs0, hs0 ∈ Prime)
  prmnn(hs0)
  eleq1d((Lam ` c0), cr, (Lam `(hs0[^]hs1)), c0 =(hs0[^]hs1))
  fveq2(c0, (hs0[^]hs1), cvma)
  0red(c0 ∈ ℕ)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(cprime)
  diff.hs0.w((Lam ` c0)∈ ℝ)

blocks.name: vmaf
blocks.content: Functionality of the von Mangoldt function. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 7-Apr-2016.)
blocks.origin:
thm vmaf() {
  |- wf(cvma, cn, cr)
} = {
  mptru(wf(cvma, cn, cr))
  fmpt2d(hs0, hs1, cvma, cn, cr, csb(hs2, crab(hs3, cprime, wbr(cv(hs3), cdvds, cv(hs0))), cif(cfv(clog, cuni(cv(hs2))), nat0, wceq(cfv(chash, cv(hs2)), nat1))), universe, wtru)
  a1i(wa(wtru, wcel(cv(hs0), cn)), wcel(csb(hs2, crab(hs3, cprime, wbr(cv(hs3), cdvds, cv(hs0))), cif(cfv(clog, cuni(cv(hs2))), nat0, wceq(cfv(chash, cv(hs2)), nat1))), universe))
  csbex(hs2, crab(hs3, cprime, wbr(cv(hs3), cdvds, cv(hs0))), cif(cfv(clog, cuni(cv(hs2))), nat0, wceq(cfv(chash, cv(hs2)), nat1)))
  ifex(cfv(clog, cuni(cv(hs2))), nat0, wceq(cfv(chash, cv(hs2)), nat1))
  fvex(clog, cuni(cv(hs2)))
  c0ex()
  a1i(wtru, wceq(cvma, cmpt(hs0, cn, csb(hs2, crab(hs3, cprime, wbr(cv(hs3), cdvds, cv(hs0))), cif(cfv(clog, cuni(cv(hs2))), nat0, wceq(cfv(chash, cv(hs2)), nat1))))))
  df-vma(hs0, hs3, hs2)
  adantl(wtru, wcel(cv(hs1), cn), wcel(cfv(cvma, cv(hs1)), cr))
  vmacl(cv(hs1))
  diff.hs0.c(cn)
  diff.hs1.c(cvma)
  diff.hs1.c(cn)
  diff.hs1.c(cr)
  diff.hs0.w(wtru)
  diff.hs1.w(wtru)
  diff.hs3.s(hs2)
  diff.hs0.s(hs3)
  diff.hs0.s(hs2)
}

} = {

  adantl(wtru, hs1 ∈ ℕ, (Lam ` hs1)∈ ℝ)
  vmacl(hs1)

  diff.hs1.c(cvma)

blocks.name: efvmacl
blocks.content: The von Mangoldt is closed in the log-integers. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 7-Apr-2016.)
blocks.origin:
thm efvmacl(class c0) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(cfv(ce, cfv(cvma, c0)), cn))
} = {
  pm2.61ne(cfv(cvma, c0), nat0, wcel(c0, cn), wcel(cfv(ce, cfv(cvma, c0)), cn), wcel(nat1, cn))
  eleq1d(cfv(ce, cfv(cvma, c0)), cn, nat1, wceq(cfv(cvma, c0), nat0))
  syl6eq(cfv(ce, cfv(cvma, c0)), nat1, cfv(ce, nat0), wceq(cfv(cvma, c0), nat0))
  fveq2(cfv(cvma, c0), nat0, ce)
  ef0()
  imp(wcel(c0, cn), wne(cfv(cvma, c0), nat0), wcel(cfv(ce, cfv(cvma, c0)), cn))
  syl6bi(wcel(c0, cn), wne(cfv(cvma, c0), nat0), wcel(cfv(ce, cfv(cvma, c0)), cn), wrex(hs0, cprime, wrex(hs1, cn, wceq(c0, co(cv(hs0), cexp, cv(hs1))))))
  isppw2(hs0, hs1, c0)
  rexlimivv(hs0, hs1, cprime, cn, wceq(c0, co(cv(hs0), cexp, cv(hs1))), wcel(cfv(ce, cfv(cvma, c0)), cn))
  syl5ibrcom(wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cprime), wcel(cv(hs1), cn)), wceq(c0, co(cv(hs0), cexp, cv(hs1))), wcel(cfv(ce, cfv(cvma, c0)), cn), wcel(cfv(ce, cfv(cvma, co(cv(hs0), cexp, cv(hs1)))), cn))
  eqeltrd(cfv(ce, cfv(cvma, co(cv(hs0), cexp, cv(hs1)))), cn, cfv(ce, cfv(clog, cv(hs0))), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cprime), wcel(cv(hs1), cn)))
  fveq2d(ce, cfv(cvma, co(cv(hs0), cexp, cv(hs1))), cfv(clog, cv(hs0)), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cprime), wcel(cv(hs1), cn)))
  vmappw(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))
  adantr(wcel(cv(hs0), cprime), wcel(cv(hs1), cn), wcel(cfv(ce, cfv(clog, cv(hs0))), cn))
  eqeltrd(cfv(ce, cfv(clog, cv(hs0))), cn, cv(hs0), wcel(cv(hs0), cprime))
  reeflogd(cv(hs0), wcel(cv(hs0), cprime))
  nnrpd(cv(hs0), wcel(cv(hs0), cprime))
  prmnn(cv(hs0))
  eleq1d(cfv(ce, cfv(cvma, c0)), cn, cfv(ce, cfv(cvma, co(cv(hs0), cexp, cv(hs1)))), wceq(c0, co(cv(hs0), cexp, cv(hs1))))
  fveq2d(ce, cfv(cvma, c0), cfv(cvma, co(cv(hs0), cexp, cv(hs1))), wceq(c0, co(cv(hs0), cexp, cv(hs1))))
  fveq2(c0, co(cv(hs0), cexp, cv(hs1)), cvma)
  a1i(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(nat1, cn))
  1nn()
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(cprime)
  diff.hs0.w(wcel(cfv(ce, cfv(cvma, c0)), cn))
  diff.hs1.w(wcel(cfv(ce, cfv(cvma, c0)), cn))
}

} = {

  eqeltrd((exp `(Lam `(hs0[^]hs1))), cn, (exp `(log ` hs0)), (hs0 ∈ Prime ∧ hs1 ∈ ℕ))

blocks.origin:
thm chpval(setvar s0, class c0) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cr), wceq(cfv(cchp, c0), csu(s0, co(nat1, cfz, cfv(cfl, c0)), cfv(cvma, cv(s0)))))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
} = {
  fvmpt(hs0, c0, cr, cchp, csu(s0, co(nat1, cfz, cfv(cfl, c0)), cfv(cvma, cv(s0))), csu(s0, co(nat1, cfz, cfv(cfl, cv(hs0))), cfv(cvma, cv(s0))))
  sumeq1d(s0, co(nat1, cfz, cfv(cfl, cv(hs0))), cfv(cvma, cv(s0)), co(nat1, cfz, cfv(cfl, c0)), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  oveq2d(nat1, cfz, cfv(cfl, cv(hs0)), cfv(cfl, c0), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  fveq2(cv(hs0), c0, cfl)
  df-chp(hs0, s0)
  sumex(s0, co(nat1, cfz, cfv(cfl, c0)), cfv(cvma, cv(s0)))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cr)

thm issqf(setvar s0, class c0) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cn), wb(wne(cfv(cmu, c0), nat0), wral(s0, cprime, wbr(co(cv(s0), cpc, c0), cle, nat1))))

  ralnex(s0, cprime, wbr(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), cdvds, c0))

  con1bid(wa(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(cv(s0), cprime)), wbr(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), cdvds, c0), wbr(co(cv(s0), cpc, c0), cle, nat1))
  3bitr3d(wa(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(cv(s0), cprime)), wn(wbr(co(cv(s0), cpc, c0), cle, nat1)), wbr(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), cdvds, c0), wbr(nat1, clt, co(cv(s0), cpc, c0)), wbr(co(nat1, caddc, nat1), cle, co(cv(s0), cpc, c0)))
  sylancr(wa(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(cv(s0), cprime)), wb(wbr(nat1, clt, co(cv(s0), cpc, c0)), wbr(co(nat1, caddc, nat1), cle, co(cv(s0), cpc, c0))), wcel(nat1, cn0), wcel(co(cv(s0), cpc, c0), cn0))
  1nn0()
  nn0ltp1le(nat1, co(cv(s0), cpc, c0))
  sylancr(wa(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(cv(s0), cprime)), wb(wbr(nat1, clt, co(cv(s0), cpc, c0)), wn(wbr(co(cv(s0), cpc, c0), cle, nat1))), wcel(nat1, cr), wcel(co(cv(s0), cpc, c0), cr))
  1re()
  nn0red(co(cv(s0), cpc, c0), wa(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(cv(s0), cprime)))

  pccl(cv(s0), c0)

  syl5bbr(wa(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(cv(s0), cprime)), wbr(co(nat1, caddc, nat1), cle, co(cv(s0), cpc, c0)), wbr(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), cdvds, c0), wbr(nat2, cle, co(cv(s0), cpc, c0)))

  df-2()
  syl2anr(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(cv(s0), cprime), wb(wbr(nat2, cle, co(cv(s0), cpc, c0)), wbr(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), cdvds, c0)), wcel(cv(s0), cprime), wcel(c0, cz))
  id(wcel(cv(s0), cprime))
  nnz(c0)
  mp3an3(wcel(cv(s0), cprime), wcel(c0, cz), wb(wbr(nat2, cle, co(cv(s0), cpc, c0)), wbr(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), cdvds, c0)), wcel(nat2, cn0))

  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
} = {

  1re()
  nn0red((s0[pCnt]c0), (c0 ∈ ℕ ∧ s0 ∈ Prime))

blocks.name: sqfpc
blocks.content: The prime count of a squarefree number is at most 1. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 1-Jul-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm sqfpc(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, cn), wne(cfv(cmu, c0), nat0), wcel(c1, cprime)), wbr(co(c1, cpc, c0), cle, nat1))
} = {
  3impia(wcel(c0, cn), wne(cfv(cmu, c0), nat0), wcel(c1, cprime), wbr(co(c1, cpc, c0), cle, nat1))
  syl(wa(wcel(c0, cn), wne(cfv(cmu, c0), nat0)), wi(wcel(c1, cprime), wbr(co(c1, cpc, c0), cle, nat1)), wral(hs0, cprime, wbr(co(cv(hs0), cpc, c0), cle, nat1)))
  biimpa(wcel(c0, cn), wne(cfv(cmu, c0), nat0), wral(hs0, cprime, wbr(co(cv(hs0), cpc, c0), cle, nat1)))
  issqf(hs0, c0)
  rspccv(hs0, cprime, c1, wbr(co(cv(hs0), cpc, c0), cle, nat1), wbr(co(c1, cpc, c0), cle, nat1))
  breq1d(co(cv(hs0), cpc, c0), cle, nat1, co(c1, cpc, c0), wceq(cv(hs0), c1))
  oveq1(cv(hs0), c1, cpc, c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cprime)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.w(wbr(co(c1, cpc, c0), cle, nat1))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm sqfpc(class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ ℕ ∧(mmu ` c0)≠ 0 ∧ c1 ∈ Prime)→(c1[pCnt]c0)[≤]1)
} = {
  3impia(c0 ∈ ℕ, (mmu ` c0)≠ 0, c1 ∈ Prime, (c1[pCnt]c0)[≤]1)
  syl((c0 ∈ ℕ ∧(mmu ` c0)≠ 0), (c1 ∈ Prime →(c1[pCnt]c0)[≤]1), ∀(hs0 ∈ Prime,(hs0[pCnt]c0)[≤]1))
  biimpa(c0 ∈ ℕ, (mmu ` c0)≠ 0, ∀(hs0 ∈ Prime,(hs0[pCnt]c0)[≤]1))
  issqf(hs0, c0)
  rspccv(hs0, cprime, c1, (hs0[pCnt]c0)[≤]1, (c1[pCnt]c0)[≤]1)
  breq1d((hs0[pCnt]c0), cle, nat1, (c1[pCnt]c0), hs0 = c1)
  oveq1(hs0, c1, cpc, c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cprime)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.w((c1[pCnt]c0)[≤]1)
}

blocks.name: dvdssqf
blocks.content: A divisor of a squarefree number is squarefree. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 1-Jul-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm dvdssqf(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, cn), wbr(c1, cdvds, c0)), wi(wne(cfv(cmu, c0), nat0), wne(cfv(cmu, c1), nat0)))
} = {
  necon3d(cfv(cmu, c0), nat0, cfv(cmu, c1), nat0, w3a(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, cn), wbr(c1, cdvds, c0)))
  3imtr4d(w3a(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, cn), wbr(c1, cdvds, c0)), wceq(cfv(cmu, c1), nat0), wceq(cfv(cmu, c0), nat0), wrex(hs0, cprime, wbr(co(cv(hs0), cexp, nat2), cdvds, c1)), wrex(hs0, cprime, wbr(co(cv(hs0), cexp, nat2), cdvds, c0)))

thm dvdssqf(class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ ℕ ∧ c1 ∈ ℕ ∧ c1[||]c0)→((mmu ` c0)≠ 0 →(mmu ` c1)≠ 0))
} = {
  necon3d((mmu ` c0), nat0, (mmu ` c1), nat0, (c0 ∈ ℕ ∧ c1 ∈ ℕ ∧ c1[||]c0))
  3imtr4d((c0 ∈ ℕ ∧ c1 ∈ ℕ ∧ c1[||]c0), (mmu ` c1)= 0, (mmu ` c0)= 0, ∃(hs0 ∈ Prime,(hs0[^]2)[||]c1), ∃(hs0 ∈ Prime,(hs0[^]2)[||]c0))
  reximdva(hs0, cprime, (c0 ∈ ℕ ∧ c1 ∈ ℕ ∧ c1[||]c0), (hs0[^]2)[||]c1, (hs0[^]2)[||]c0)
  mpan2d(((c0 ∈ ℕ ∧ c1 ∈ ℕ ∧ c1[||]c0)∧ hs0 ∈ Prime), (hs0[^]2)[||]c1, (hs0[^]2)[||]c0, c1[||]c0)
  simpl3(c0 ∈ ℕ, c1 ∈ ℕ, c1[||]c0, hs0 ∈ Prime)
  syl3anc(((c0 ∈ ℕ ∧ c1 ∈ ℕ ∧ c1[||]c0)∧ hs0 ∈ Prime), (((hs0[^]2)[||]c1 ∧ c1[||]c0)→(hs0[^]2)[||]c0), (hs0[^]2)∈ ℤ, c1 ∈ ℤ, c0 ∈ ℤ)
  syl(((c0 ∈ ℕ ∧ c1 ∈ ℕ ∧ c1[||]c0)∧ hs0 ∈ Prime), (hs0[^]2)∈ ℤ, hs0 ∈ ℤ)
  adantl((c0 ∈ ℕ ∧ c1 ∈ ℕ ∧ c1[||]c0), hs0 ∈ Prime, hs0 ∈ ℤ)
  prmz(hs0)
  zsqcl(hs0)
  nnzd(c1, ((c0 ∈ ℕ ∧ c1 ∈ ℕ ∧ c1[||]c0)∧ hs0 ∈ Prime))
  simpl2(c0 ∈ ℕ, c1 ∈ ℕ, c1[||]c0, hs0 ∈ Prime)
  nnzd(c0, ((c0 ∈ ℕ ∧ c1 ∈ ℕ ∧ c1[||]c0)∧ hs0 ∈ Prime))
  simpl1(c0 ∈ ℕ, c1 ∈ ℕ, c1[||]c0, hs0 ∈ Prime)
  dvdstr((hs0[^]2), c1, c0)
  3ad2ant2(c0 ∈ ℕ, c1 ∈ ℕ, c1[||]c0, ((mmu ` c1)= 0 ↔ ∃(hs0 ∈ Prime,(hs0[^]2)[||]c1)))
  isnsqf(hs0, c1)
  3ad2ant1(c0 ∈ ℕ, c1 ∈ ℕ, c1[||]c0, ((mmu ` c0)= 0 ↔ ∃(hs0 ∈ Prime,(hs0[^]2)[||]c0)))
  isnsqf(hs0, c0)
  diff.hs0.w((c0 ∈ ℕ ∧ c1 ∈ ℕ ∧ c1[||]c0))
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
}

thm chtwordi(class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ ∧ c0[≤]c1)→(θ ` c0)[≤](θ ` c1))
} = {
  3brtr4d((θ ` c0), cle, (θ ` c1), sum(hs0 ∈((0[[,]]c0)⋂ Prime),(log ` hs0)), sum(hs0 ∈((0[[,]]c1)⋂ Prime),(log ` hs0)), (c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ ∧ c0[≤]c1))
  fsumless(hs0, ((0[[,]]c0)⋂ Prime), (log ` hs0), ((0[[,]]c1)⋂ Prime), (c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ ∧ c0[≤]c1))
  syl((c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ ∧ c0[≤]c1), ((0[[,]]c1)⋂ Prime)∈ Fin, c1 ∈ ℝ)
  ppifi(c1)
  rpred((log ` hs0), ((c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ ∧ c0[≤]c1)∧ hs0 ∈((0[[,]]c1)⋂ Prime)))
  rpge0d((log ` hs0), ((c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ ∧ c0[≤]c1)∧ hs0 ∈((0[[,]]c1)⋂ Prime)))
  rplogcld(hs0, ((c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ ∧ c0[≤]c1)∧ hs0 ∈((0[[,]]c1)⋂ Prime)))
  nnred(hs0, ((c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ ∧ c0[≤]c1)∧ hs0 ∈((0[[,]]c1)⋂ Prime)))
  simpld(((c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ ∧ c0[≤]c1)∧ hs0 ∈((0[[,]]c1)⋂ Prime)), hs0 ∈ ℕ, 1[<]hs0)
  simprd(((c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ ∧ c0[≤]c1)∧ hs0 ∈((0[[,]]c1)⋂ Prime)), 1[<]hs0, hs0 ∈ ℕ)
  sylib(((c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ ∧ c0[≤]c1)∧ hs0 ∈((0[[,]]c1)⋂ Prime)), (hs0 ∈ ℕ ∧ 1[<]hs0), hs0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` 2))
  syl(((c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ ∧ c0[≤]c1)∧ hs0 ∈((0[[,]]c1)⋂ Prime)), hs0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` 2), hs0 ∈ Prime)
  elin2d(hs0, cprime, (0[[,]]c1), ((c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ ∧ c0[≤]c1)∧ hs0 ∈((0[[,]]c1)⋂ Prime)))
  simpr((c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ ∧ c0[≤]c1), hs0 ∈((0[[,]]c1)⋂ Prime))
  prmuz2(hs0)
  eluz2b2(hs0)
  ssrind((0[[,]]c0), cprime, (0[[,]]c1), (c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ ∧ c0[≤]c1))
  syl22anc((c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ ∧ c0[≤]c1), (0[[,]]c0)⊆(0[[,]]c1), 0 ∈ ℝ, c1 ∈ ℝ, 0[≤]0, c0[≤]c1)
  0red((c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ ∧ c0[≤]c1))
  a1i((c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ ∧ c0[≤]c1), 0[≤]0)
  0le0()
  simp3(c0 ∈ ℝ, c1 ∈ ℝ, c0[≤]c1)
  iccss(nat0, c1, nat0, c0)
  3ad2ant1(c0 ∈ ℝ, c1 ∈ ℝ, c0[≤]c1, (θ ` c0)= sum(hs0 ∈((0[[,]]c0)⋂ Prime),(log ` hs0)))
  chtval(hs0, c0)
  syl((c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ ∧ c0[≤]c1), (θ ` c1)= sum(hs0 ∈((0[[,]]c1)⋂ Prime),(log ` hs0)), c1 ∈ ℝ)
  simp2(c0 ∈ ℝ, c1 ∈ ℝ, c0[≤]c1)
  chtval(hs0, c1)

  diff.hs0.c(((0[[,]]c1)⋂ Prime))
  diff.hs0.w((c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ ∧ c0[≤]c1))

blocks.name: efchtdvds
blocks.content: The exponentiated Chebyshev function forms a divisibility chain between any two points. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 22-Sep-2014.)

blocks.name: ppifl
blocks.content: The prime-counting function ` ppi ` does not change off the integers. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 18-Sep-2014.)

blocks.name: ppip1le
blocks.content: The prime-counting function ` ppi ` cannot locally increase faster than the identity function. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 21-Sep-2014.)

  leexp2ad(cv(hs0), nat1, cv(hs1), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cprime), wcel(cv(hs1), cn)))
  nnred(cv(hs0), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cprime), wcel(cv(hs1), cn)))
  nnge1d(cv(hs0), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cprime), wcel(cv(hs1), cn)))
  simpld(wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cprime), wcel(cv(hs1), cn)), wcel(cv(hs0), cn), wbr(nat1, clt, cv(hs0)))

  necon1bbii(cfv(cvma, nat1), nat0, wrex(hs0, cprime, wrex(hs1, cn, wceq(nat1, co(cv(hs0), cexp, cv(hs1))))))
  ax-mp(wb(wne(cfv(cvma, nat1), nat0), wrex(hs0, cprime, wrex(hs1, cn, wceq(nat1, co(cv(hs0), cexp, cv(hs1)))))), wcel(nat1, cn))

thm ppi1i(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wceq(cfv(cppi, c0), co(c1, caddc, nat1))
  -| wcel(c2, cn0)
  -| wceq(c0, co(c2, caddc, nat1))
  -| wceq(cfv(cppi, c2), c1)
  -| wcel(c0, cprime)
} = {
  3eqtri(cfv(cppi, c0), co(c1, caddc, nat1), cfv(cppi, co(c2, caddc, nat1)), co(cfv(cppi, c2), caddc, nat1))
  fveq2i(cppi, c0, co(c2, caddc, nat1))
  mp2an(wceq(cfv(cppi, co(c2, caddc, nat1)), co(cfv(cppi, c2), caddc, nat1)), wcel(c2, cz), wcel(co(c2, caddc, nat1), cprime))
  nn0zi(c2)
  eqeltrri(co(c2, caddc, nat1), cprime, c0)
  ppiprm(c2)
  oveq1i(cfv(cppi, c2), caddc, nat1, c1)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm ppi1i(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  ⊢ (ppi ` c0)=(c1[+]1)
  ⊣ c2 ∈ ℕ0
  ⊣ c0 =(c2[+]1)
  ⊣ (ppi ` c2)= c1
  ⊣ c0 ∈ Prime
} = {
  3eqtri((ppi ` c0), (c1[+]1), (ppi `(c2[+]1)), ((ppi ` c2)[+]1))
  fveq2i(cppi, c0, (c2[+]1))
  mp2an((ppi `(c2[+]1))=((ppi ` c2)[+]1), c2 ∈ ℤ, (c2[+]1)∈ Prime)
  nn0zi(c2)
  eqeltrri((c2[+]1), cprime, c0)
  ppiprm(c2)
  oveq1i((ppi ` c2), caddc, nat1, c1)
}

blocks.name: ppi2i
blocks.content: Inference form of ~ ppinprm . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 21-Sep-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm ppi2i(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wceq(cfv(cppi, c0), c1)
  -| wcel(c2, cn0)
  -| wceq(c0, co(c2, caddc, nat1))
  -| wceq(cfv(cppi, c2), c1)
  -| wn(wcel(c0, cprime))
} = {
  3eqtri(cfv(cppi, c0), c1, cfv(cppi, co(c2, caddc, nat1)), cfv(cppi, c2))
  fveq2i(cppi, c0, co(c2, caddc, nat1))
  mp2an(wceq(cfv(cppi, co(c2, caddc, nat1)), cfv(cppi, c2)), wcel(c2, cz), wn(wcel(co(c2, caddc, nat1), cprime)))
  nn0zi(c2)
  mtbi(wcel(co(c2, caddc, nat1), cprime), wcel(c0, cprime))
  eleq1i(c0, cprime, co(c2, caddc, nat1))
  ppinprm(c2)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm ppi2i(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  ⊢ (ppi ` c0)= c1
  ⊣ c2 ∈ ℕ0
  ⊣ c0 =(c2[+]1)
  ⊣ (ppi ` c2)= c1
  ⊣ ¬ c0 ∈ Prime
} = {
  3eqtri((ppi ` c0), c1, (ppi `(c2[+]1)), (ppi ` c2))
  fveq2i(cppi, c0, (c2[+]1))

  mtbi((c2[+]1)∈ Prime, c0 ∈ Prime)
  eleq1i(c0, cprime, (c2[+]1))
  ppinprm(c2)
}

  ppi2()
  mp3an1(wcel(c0, cr), wbr(nat2, cle, c0), wbr(cfv(cppi, nat2), cle, cfv(cppi, c0)), wcel(nat2, cr))

  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ 2[≤]c0)→(θ ` c0)∈ ℝ+)

blocks.name: mumullem1
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ mumul . A multiple of a non-squarefree number is non-squarefree. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 3-Oct-2014.)

thm mumullem1(class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ (((c0 ∈ ℕ ∧ c1 ∈ ℕ)∧(mmu ` c0)= 0)→(mmu `(c0[×]c1))= 0)
} = {
  imp((c0 ∈ ℕ ∧ c1 ∈ ℕ), (mmu ` c0)= 0, (mmu `(c0[×]c1))= 0)
  3imtr4d((c0 ∈ ℕ ∧ c1 ∈ ℕ), (mmu ` c0)= 0, (mmu `(c0[×]c1))= 0, ∃(hs0 ∈ Prime,(hs0[^]2)[||]c0), ∃(hs0 ∈ Prime,(hs0[^]2)[||](c0[×]c1)))
  reximdva(hs0, cprime, (c0 ∈ ℕ ∧ c1 ∈ ℕ), (hs0[^]2)[||]c0, (hs0[^]2)[||](c0[×]c1))
  syl3anc(((c0 ∈ ℕ ∧ c1 ∈ ℕ)∧ hs0 ∈ Prime), ((hs0[^]2)[||]c0 →(hs0[^]2)[||](c0[×]c1)), (hs0[^]2)∈ ℤ, c0 ∈ ℤ, c1 ∈ ℤ)
  syl(((c0 ∈ ℕ ∧ c1 ∈ ℕ)∧ hs0 ∈ Prime), (hs0[^]2)∈ ℤ, hs0 ∈ ℤ)
  adantl((c0 ∈ ℕ ∧ c1 ∈ ℕ), hs0 ∈ Prime, hs0 ∈ ℤ)
  prmz(hs0)
  zsqcl(hs0)
  ad2antrr(c0 ∈ ℕ, c1 ∈ ℕ, hs0 ∈ Prime, c0 ∈ ℤ)
  nnz(c0)
  ad2antlr(c0 ∈ ℕ, c1 ∈ ℕ, hs0 ∈ Prime, c1 ∈ ℤ)
  nnz(c1)
  dvdsmultr1((hs0[^]2), c0, c1)
  adantr(c0 ∈ ℕ, c1 ∈ ℕ, ((mmu ` c0)= 0 ↔ ∃(hs0 ∈ Prime,(hs0[^]2)[||]c0)))
  isnsqf(hs0, c0)
  syl((c0 ∈ ℕ ∧ c1 ∈ ℕ), ((mmu `(c0[×]c1))= 0 ↔ ∃(hs0 ∈ Prime,(hs0[^]2)[||](c0[×]c1))), (c0[×]c1)∈ ℕ)
  nnmulcl(c0, c1)
  isnsqf(hs0, (c0[×]c1))
  diff.hs0.w((c0 ∈ ℕ ∧ c1 ∈ ℕ))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c((c0[×]c1))
}

blocks.name: mumullem2
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ mumul . The product of two coprime squarefree numbers is squarefree. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 3-Oct-2014.)

blocks.name: mumul
blocks.content: The Möbius function is a multiplicative function. This is one of the primary interests of the Möbius function as an arithmetic function. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 3-Oct-2014.)

blocks.name: sqff1o
blocks.content: There is a bijection from the squarefree divisors of a number ` N ` to the powerset of the prime divisors of ` N ` . Among other things, this implies that a number has ` 2 ^ k ` squarefree divisors where ` k ` is the number of prime divisors, and a squarefree number has ` 2 ^ k ` divisors (because all divisors of a squarefree number are squarefree). The inverse function to ` F ` takes the product of all the primes in some subset of prime divisors of ` N ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 1-Jul-2015.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: fsumdvdsdiag
blocks.content: A "diagonal commutation" of divisor sums analogous to ~ fsum0diag . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 2-Jul-2015.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 8-Apr-2016.)
blocks.origin:
thm fsumdvdsdiag(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(csu(s0, crab(s1, cn, wbr(cv(s1), cdvds, c0)), csu(s2, crab(s1, cn, wbr(cv(s1), cdvds, co(c0, cdiv, cv(s0)))), c1)), csu(s2, crab(s1, cn, wbr(cv(s1), cdvds, c0)), csu(s0, crab(s1, cn, wbr(cv(s1), cdvds, co(c0, cdiv, cv(s2)))), c1))))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, cn))

thm fsumdvdsdiag(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, wff w0) {
  ⊢ (w0 → sum(s0 ∈ { s1 ∈ ℕ | s1[||]c0 }, sum(s2 ∈ { s1 ∈ ℕ | s1[||](c0[÷]s0)}, c1))= sum(s2 ∈ { s1 ∈ ℕ | s1[||]c0 }, sum(s0 ∈ { s1 ∈ ℕ | s1[||](c0[÷]s2)}, c1)))
  ⊣ (w0 → c0 ∈ ℕ)
  ⊣ ((w0 ∧(s0 ∈ { s1 ∈ ℕ | s1[||]c0 } ∧ s2 ∈ { s1 ∈ ℕ | s1[||](c0[÷]s0)}))→ c1 ∈ ℂ)
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, s2)
  ⊣ d(s1, s2)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
  ⊣ d(s2, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, w0)
  ⊣ d(s2, w0)
} = {
  fsumcom2(s0, s2, { s1 ∈ ℕ | s1[||]c0 }, { s1 ∈ ℕ | s1[||](c0[÷]s0)}, c1, { s1 ∈ ℕ | s1[||]c0 }, { s1 ∈ ℕ | s1[||](c0[÷]s2)}, w0)
  ssfid({ s1 ∈ ℕ | s1[||]c0 }, (1[...]c0), w0)
  fzfid(nat1, c0, w0)
  syl(w0, { s1 ∈ ℕ | s1[||]c0 } ⊆(1[...]c0), c0 ∈ ℕ)
  dvdsssfz1(s1, c0)
  ssfid({ s1 ∈ ℕ | s1[||](c0[÷]s0)}, (1[...](c0[÷]s0)), (w0 ∧ s0 ∈ { s1 ∈ ℕ | s1[||]c0 }))
  fzfid(nat1, (c0[÷]s0), (w0 ∧ s0 ∈ { s1 ∈ ℕ | s1[||]c0 }))
  syl((w0 ∧ s0 ∈ { s1 ∈ ℕ | s1[||]c0 }), { s1 ∈ ℕ | s1[||](c0[÷]s0)} ⊆(1[...](c0[÷]s0)), (c0[÷]s0)∈ ℕ)
  sseldi((c0[÷]s0), cn, { s1 ∈ ℕ | s1[||]c0 }, (w0 ∧ s0 ∈ { s1 ∈ ℕ | s1[||]c0 }))
  ssrab2(s1, cn, s1[||]c0)
  sylan(w0, s0 ∈ { s1 ∈ ℕ | s1[||]c0 }, (c0[÷]s0)∈ { s1 ∈ ℕ | s1[||]c0 }, c0 ∈ ℕ)
  dvdsdivcl(s1, c0, s0)
  dvdsssfz1(s1, (c0[÷]s0))
  impbid(w0, (s0 ∈ { s1 ∈ ℕ | s1[||]c0 } ∧ s2 ∈ { s1 ∈ ℕ | s1[||](c0[÷]s0)}), (s2 ∈ { s1 ∈ ℕ | s1[||]c0 } ∧ s0 ∈ { s1 ∈ ℕ | s1[||](c0[÷]s2)}))
  fsumdvdsdiaglem(s0, s1, s2, c0, w0)
  fsumdvdsdiaglem(s2, s1, s0, c0, w0)
  diff.crab.s(s0, s1, cn, s1[||]c0)
  diff.wbr.s(s0, s1, cdvds, c0)
  diff.crab.s(s0, s1, cn, s1[||](c0[÷]s2))
  diff.cn.s(s0)
  diff.wbr.s(s0, s1, cdvds, (c0[÷]s2))
  diff.cv.s(s0, s1)
  diff.cdvds.s(s0)
  diff.co.s(s0, c0, cdiv, s2)
  diff.cdiv.s(s0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, s2)
  diff.crab.s(s2, s1, cn, s1[||]c0)
  diff.wbr.s(s2, s1, cdvds, c0)
  diff.crab.s(s2, s1, cn, s1[||](c0[÷]s0))
  diff.cn.s(s2)
  diff.wbr.s(s2, s1, cdvds, (c0[÷]s0))
  diff.cv.s(s2, s1)
  diff.cdvds.s(s2)
  diff.co.s(s2, c0, cdiv, s0)
  diff.cdiv.s(s2)
  diff.cv.s(s2, s0)
  diff.cn.s(s1)
  diff.co.s(s1, c0, cdiv, s0)
  diff.cdiv.s(s1)
  diff.cv.s(s1, s0)
  diffss.ex(s2, s1)
  diffss.ex(s2, s0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
}

blocks.content: A double commutation of divisor sums based on ~ fsumdvdsdiag . Note that ` A ` depends on both ` j ` and ` k ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 13-May-2016.)

blocks.name: dvdsppwf1o
blocks.content: A bijection from the divisors of a prime power to the integers less than the prime count. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 5-May-2016.)

blocks.name: dvdsflf1o
blocks.content: A bijection from the numbers less than ` N / A ` to the multiples of ` A ` less than ` N ` . Useful for some sum manipulations. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 3-May-2016.)

blocks.name: fsumfldivdiag
blocks.content: The right-hand side of ~ dvdsflsumcom is commutative in the variables, because it can be written as the manifestly symmetric sum over those ` <. m , n >. ` such that ` m x. n <_ A ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 4-May-2016.)
blocks.origin:
thm fsumfldivdiag(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(csu(s0, co(nat1, cfz, cfv(cfl, c0)), csu(s1, co(nat1, cfz, cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, cv(s0)))), c1)), csu(s1, co(nat1, cfz, cfv(cfl, c0)), csu(s0, co(nat1, cfz, cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, cv(s1)))), c1))))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, cr))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), co(nat1, cfz, cfv(cfl, c0))), wcel(cv(s1), co(nat1, cfz, cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, cv(s0))))))), wcel(c1, cc))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
  -| diffsw(s1, w0)
} = {
  fsumcom2(s0, s1, co(nat1, cfz, cfv(cfl, c0)), co(nat1, cfz, cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, cv(s0)))), c1, co(nat1, cfz, cfv(cfl, c0)), co(nat1, cfz, cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, cv(s1)))), w0)
  fzfid(nat1, cfv(cfl, c0), w0)
  fzfid(nat1, cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, cv(s0))), wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), co(nat1, cfz, cfv(cfl, c0)))))
  impbid(w0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), co(nat1, cfz, cfv(cfl, c0))), wcel(cv(s1), co(nat1, cfz, cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, cv(s0)))))), wa(wcel(cv(s1), co(nat1, cfz, cfv(cfl, c0))), wcel(cv(s0), co(nat1, cfz, cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, cv(s1)))))))
  fsumfldivdiaglem(s0, s1, c0, w0)
  fsumfldivdiaglem(s1, s0, c0, w0)
  diff.co.s(s0, nat1, cfz, cfv(cfl, c0))
  diff.cfv.s(s0, cfl, c0)
  diff.co.s(s0, nat1, cfz, cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, cv(s1))))
  diff.nat1.s(s0)
  diff.cfz.s(s0)
  diff.cfv.s(s0, cfl, co(c0, cdiv, cv(s1)))
  diff.cfl.s(s0)
  diff.co.s(s0, c0, cdiv, cv(s1))
  diff.cdiv.s(s0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, s1)
  diff.co.s(s1, nat1, cfz, cfv(cfl, c0))
  diff.cfv.s(s1, cfl, c0)
  diff.co.s(s1, nat1, cfz, cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, cv(s0))))
  diff.nat1.s(s1)
  diff.cfz.s(s1)
  diff.cfv.s(s1, cfl, co(c0, cdiv, cv(s0)))
  diff.cfl.s(s1)
  diff.co.s(s1, c0, cdiv, cv(s0))
  diff.cdiv.s(s1)
  diff.cv.s(s1, s0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm fsumfldivdiag(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, wff w0) {
  ⊢ (w0 → sum(s0 ∈(1[...](⌊ ` c0)), sum(s1 ∈(1[...](⌊ `(c0[÷]s0))), c1))= sum(s1 ∈(1[...](⌊ ` c0)), sum(s0 ∈(1[...](⌊ `(c0[÷]s1))), c1)))
  ⊣ (w0 → c0 ∈ ℝ)
  ⊣ ((w0 ∧(s0 ∈(1[...](⌊ ` c0))∧ s1 ∈(1[...](⌊ `(c0[÷]s0)))))→ c1 ∈ ℂ)
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, w0)
  ⊣ d(s1, w0)
} = {
  fsumcom2(s0, s1, (1[...](⌊ ` c0)), (1[...](⌊ `(c0[÷]s0))), c1, (1[...](⌊ ` c0)), (1[...](⌊ `(c0[÷]s1))), w0)
  fzfid(nat1, (⌊ ` c0), w0)
  fzfid(nat1, (⌊ `(c0[÷]s0)), (w0 ∧ s0 ∈(1[...](⌊ ` c0))))
  impbid(w0, (s0 ∈(1[...](⌊ ` c0))∧ s1 ∈(1[...](⌊ `(c0[÷]s0)))), (s1 ∈(1[...](⌊ ` c0))∧ s0 ∈(1[...](⌊ `(c0[÷]s1)))))
  fsumfldivdiaglem(s0, s1, c0, w0)
  fsumfldivdiaglem(s1, s0, c0, w0)
  diff.co.s(s0, nat1, cfz, (⌊ ` c0))
  diff.cfv.s(s0, cfl, c0)
  diff.co.s(s0, nat1, cfz, (⌊ `(c0[÷]s1)))
  diff.nat1.s(s0)
  diff.cfz.s(s0)
  diff.cfv.s(s0, cfl, (c0[÷]s1))
  diff.cfl.s(s0)
  diff.co.s(s0, c0, cdiv, s1)
  diff.cdiv.s(s0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, s1)
  diff.co.s(s1, nat1, cfz, (⌊ ` c0))
  diff.cfv.s(s1, cfl, c0)
  diff.co.s(s1, nat1, cfz, (⌊ `(c0[÷]s0)))
  diff.nat1.s(s1)
  diff.cfz.s(s1)
  diff.cfv.s(s1, cfl, (c0[÷]s0))
  diff.cfl.s(s1)
  diff.co.s(s1, c0, cdiv, s0)
  diff.cdiv.s(s1)
  diff.cv.s(s1, s0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
}

blocks.name: musum
blocks.content: The sum of the Möbius function over the divisors of ` N ` gives one if ` N = 1 ` , but otherwise always sums to zero. Theorem 2.1 in [ApostolNT] p. 25. This makes the Möbius function useful for inverting divisor sums; see also ~ muinv . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 2-Jul-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm musum(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cn), wceq(csu(s0, crab(s1, cn, wbr(cv(s1), cdvds, c0)), cfv(cmu, cv(s0))), cif(nat1, nat0, wceq(c0, nat1))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
} = {
  3eqtr3d(csu(s0, crab(s1, cn, wbr(cv(s1), cdvds, c0)), cfv(cmu, cv(s0))), cif(nat1, nat0, wceq(c0, nat1)), csu(s0, crab(s1, cn, wa(wne(cfv(cmu, cv(s1)), nat0), wbr(cv(s1), cdvds, c0))), cfv(cmu, cv(s0))), csu(s0, crab(s1, cn, wa(wne(cfv(cmu, cv(s1)), nat0), wbr(cv(s1), cdvds, c0))), co(cneg(nat1), cexp, cfv(chash, crab(hs0, cprime, wbr(cv(hs0), cdvds, cv(s0)))))), wcel(c0, cn))

blocks.name: musumsum
blocks.content: Evaluate a collapsing sum over the Möbius function. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 4-May-2016.)
blocks.origin:
thm musumsum(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(csu(s0, c0, csu(s1, crab(s2, cn, wbr(cv(s2), cdvds, cv(s0))), co(cfv(cmu, cv(s1)), cmul, c1))), c2))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), nat1), wceq(c1, c2))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, cfn))
  -| wi(w0, wss(c0, cn))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(nat1, c0))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wcel(c1, cc))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)

thm musumsum(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0) {
  ⊢ (w0 → sum(s0 ∈ c0, sum(s1 ∈ { s2 ∈ ℕ | s2[||]s0 },((mmu ` s1)[×]c1)))= c2)
  ⊣ (s0 = 1 → c1 = c2)
  ⊣ (w0 → c0 ∈ Fin)
  ⊣ (w0 → c0 ⊆ ℕ)
  ⊣ (w0 → 1 ∈ c0)
  ⊣ ((w0 ∧ s0 ∈ c0)→ c1 ∈ ℂ)
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, s2)
  ⊣ d(s1, s2)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c2)
  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
  ⊣ d(s1, c1)
  ⊣ d(s0, w0)
  ⊣ d(s1, w0)
} = {
  3eqtr2d(sum(s0 ∈ c0, sum(s1 ∈ { s2 ∈ ℕ | s2[||]s0 },((mmu ` s1)[×]c1))), c2, sum(s0 ∈ c0, if(s0 ∈ { 1 }, c1, 0)), sum(s0 ∈ { 1 }, c1), w0)
  sumeq2dv(s0, c0, sum(s1 ∈ { s2 ∈ ℕ | s2[||]s0 },((mmu ` s1)[×]c1)), if(s0 ∈ { 1 }, c1, 0), w0)
  3eqtr3d(sum(s1 ∈ { s2 ∈ ℕ | s2[||]s0 },((mmu ` s1)[×]c1)), if(s0 ∈ { 1 }, c1, 0), (sum(s1 ∈ { s2 ∈ ℕ | s2[||]s0 },(mmu ` s1))[×]c1), (if(s0 = 1, 1, 0)[×]c1), (w0 ∧ s0 ∈ c0))
  oveq1d(sum(s1 ∈ { s2 ∈ ℕ | s2[||]s0 },(mmu ` s1)), cmul, c1, if(s0 = 1, 1, 0), (w0 ∧ s0 ∈ c0))
  syl((w0 ∧ s0 ∈ c0), sum(s1 ∈ { s2 ∈ ℕ | s2[||]s0 },(mmu ` s1))= if(s0 = 1, 1, 0), s0 ∈ ℕ)
  musum(s1, s2, s0)
  fsummulc1(s1, { s2 ∈ ℕ | s2[||]s0 }, (mmu ` s1), c1, (w0 ∧ s0 ∈ c0))
  ssfid({ s2 ∈ ℕ | s2[||]s0 }, (1[...]s0), (w0 ∧ s0 ∈ c0))
  fzfid(nat1, s0, (w0 ∧ s0 ∈ c0))

  dvdsssfz1(s2, s0)

  zcnd((mmu ` s1), s1 ∈ { s2 ∈ ℕ | s2[||]s0 })

  ovif(nat1, nat0, cmul, c1, s0 = 1)

  ifbieq12d((1[×]c1), (0[×]c1), c1, nat0, c1 ∈ ℂ, s0 = 1, s0 ∈ { 1 })
  a1i(c1 ∈ ℂ, (s0 = 1 ↔ s0 ∈ { 1 }))
  bicomi(s0 = 1, s0 ∈ { 1 })
  velsn(s0, nat1)
  mulid2(c1)
  mul02(c1)
  syl21anc(w0, sum(s0 ∈ { 1 }, c1)= sum(s0 ∈ c0, if(s0 ∈ { 1 }, c1, 0)), { 1 } ⊆ c0, ∀(s0 ∈ { 1 }, c1 ∈ ℂ), (c0 ⊆(ℤ≥ ` 1)∨ c0 ∈ Fin))

blocks.name: muinv
blocks.content: The Möbius inversion formula. If ` G ( n ) = sum_ k || n F ( k ) ` for every ` n e. NN ` , then ` F ( n ) = sum_ k || n ` ` mmu ( k ) G ( n / k ) = sum_ k || n mmu ( n / k ) G ( k ) ` , i.e. the Möbius function is the Dirichlet convolution inverse of the constant function ` 1 ` . Theorem 2.9 in [ApostolNT] p. 32. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 2-Jul-2015.)

blocks.name: dvdsmulf1o
blocks.content: If ` M ` and ` N ` are two coprime integers, multiplication forms a bijection from the set of pairs ` <. j , k >. ` where ` j || M ` and ` k || N ` , to the set of divisors of ` M x. N ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 2-Jul-2015.)

blocks.name: fsumdvdsmul
blocks.content: Product of two divisor sums. (This is also the main part of the proof that " ` sum_ k || N F ( k ) ` is a multiplicative function if ` F ` is".) (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 2-Jul-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm fsumdvdsmul(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, class c8, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(co(csu(s0, c0, c1), cmul, csu(s1, c2, c3)), csu(s2, c4, c5)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c6, cn))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c7, cn))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(co(c6, cgcd, c7), nat1))
  -| wceq(c0, crab(s3, cn, wbr(cv(s3), cdvds, c6)))

blocks.name: fsumvma
blocks.content: Rewrite a sum over the von Mangoldt function as a sum over prime powers. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 15-Apr-2016.)
blocks.origin:
thm fsumvma(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(csu(s0, c0, c1), csu(s1, c2, csu(s2, c3, c4))))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), co(cv(s1), cexp, cv(s2))), wceq(c1, c4))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, cfn))
  -| wi(w0, wss(c0, cn))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, cfn))
  -| wi(w0, wb(wa(wcel(cv(s1), c2), wcel(cv(s2), c3)), wa(wa(wcel(cv(s1), cprime), wcel(cv(s2), cn)), wcel(co(cv(s1), cexp, cv(s2)), c0))))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wcel(c1, cc))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wceq(cfv(cvma, cv(s0)), nat0))), wceq(c1, nat0))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s2, c0)
  -| diffsc(s2, c1)
  -| diffsc(s2, c2)
  -| diffsc(s2, c3)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
  -| diffsw(s1, w0)
  -| diffsw(s2, w0)

blocks.name: fsumvma2
blocks.content: Apply ~ fsumvma for the common case of all numbers less than a real number ` A ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 30-Apr-2016.)

blocks.name: pclogsum
blocks.content: The logarithmic analogue of ~ pcprod . The sum of the logarithms of the primes dividing ` A ` multiplied by their powers yields the logarithm of ` A ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 15-Apr-2016.)

blocks.name: vmasum

blocks.name: chpval2
blocks.content: Express the second Chebyshev function directly as a sum over the primes less than ` A ` (instead of indirectly through the von Mangoldt function). (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 8-Apr-2016.)

blocks.name: chpchtsum
blocks.content: The second Chebyshev function is the sum of the theta function at arguments quickly approaching zero. (This is usually stated as an infinite sum, but after a certain point, the terms are all zero, and it is easier for us to use an explicit finite sum.) (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 7-Apr-2016.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: logfacrlim
blocks.content: Combine the estimates ~ logfacubnd and ~ logfaclbnd , to get ` log ( x ! ) = x log x + O ( x ) ` . Equation 9.2.9 of [Shapiro], p. 329. This is a weak form of the even stronger statement, ` log ( x ! ) = x log x - x + O ( log x ) ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 16-Apr-2016.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 21-May-2016.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: logexprlim
blocks.content: The sum ` sum_ n <_ x , log ^ N ( x / n ) ` has the asymptotic expansion ` ( N ! ) x + o ( x ) ` . (More precisely, the omitted term has order ` O ( log ^ N ( x ) / x ) ` .) (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 22-May-2016.)
